creator: chrispesarchick@westfieldgrp.com
text:
We have suse 8.1 machine running jdk 1.4.1.  We started up rmiregistry and
jmeter -s.  We then started jmeter on a windows NT 4 machine, opened a script
and selected remote start, and all ran well.

We copied jmeter code from NT to suse linux 8.1 laptop.  When we ran remote
start we received the execption below.  We downloaded clean source and after
rebuilding jmeter (another bug was filed on the need to rebuild) we received the
same exception.



Exception from jmeter.log on the remote side.
01/29/2003 2:05:14 PM ERROR - jmeter.elements:  java.rmi.ConnectException:
Connection refused to host: 127.0.0.2; nested exception is:
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPEndpoint.newSocket(TCPEndpoint.java:567)
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPChannel.createConnection(TCPChannel.java:185)
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPChannel.newConnection(TCPChannel.java:171)
        at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.invoke(UnicastRef.java:101)
        at
org.apache.jmeter.samplers.RemoteSampleListenerImpl_Stub.testEnded(Unknown Source)
        at
org.apache.jmeter.samplers.RemoteTestListenerWrapper.testEnded(RemoteTestListenerWrapper.java:72)
        at
org.apache.jmeter.engine.StandardJMeterEngine.notifyTestListenersOfEnd(StandardJMeterEngine.java:260)
        at
org.apache.jmeter.engine.StandardJMeterEngine.run(StandardJMeterEngine.java:321)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)
Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(PlainSocketImpl.java:305)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(PlainSocketImpl.java:171)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:158)
        at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:426)
        at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:376)
        at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:291)
        at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:119)
        at
sun.rmi.transport.proxy.RMIDirectSocketFactory.createSocket(RMIDirectSocketFactory.java:22)
        at
sun.rmi.transport.proxy.RMIMasterSocketFactory.createSocket(RMIMasterSocketFactory.java:128)
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPEndpoint.newSocket(TCPEndpoint.java:562)
        ... 8 more

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
A user verified that the current CVS code works (remote testing) with Linux and
Sun's jdk1.4.  I can't test it personally, so I'm going to assume it is working.
